intro: Senecio choroensis, commonly known as the Choros mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Senecio choroensis is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
